content: - Wow, this is some hardcore account of Taliban azz-kicking. quote: Fight by fight, the infantryman’s war in Afghanistan is often waged on the Taliban’s terms. Insurgents ambush convoys and patrols from high ridges or long ranges, and slip away as the Americans, weighed down by equipment, return fire and call for air and artillery support. Last week a patrol from the First Infantry Division reversed the routine. [snip] The lead fighter had almost reached the platoon when Pvt. First Class Troy Pacini-Harvey, 19, his laser trained on the lead man’s forehead, moved his rifle’s selector lever from safe to semi-automatic. It made a barely audible click. The Taliban fighter froze. He was six feet away. "http://www.nytimes.com/2009/04/17/world/asia/17afghan.html?hpw" Youse guys need to read the NY Times more often - I'm kinda amazed this story hasn't been posted already. Especially the bit about stabbing the Talib in the eye with his combat knife! -
quote: Fight by fight, the infantryman’s war in Afghanistan is often waged on the Taliban’s terms. Insurgents ambush convoys and patrols from high ridges or long ranges, and slip away as the Americans, weighed down by equipment, return fire and call for air and artillery support. Last week a patrol from the First Infantry Division reversed the routine. [snip] The lead fighter had almost reached the platoon when Pvt. First Class Troy Pacini-Harvey, 19, his laser trained on the lead man’s forehead, moved his rifle’s selector lever from safe to semi-automatic. It made a barely audible click. The Taliban fighter froze. He was six feet away.
reply: - Wow, this is some hardcore account of Taliban azz-kicking.  "http://www.nytimes.com/2009/04/17/world/asia/17afghan.html?hpw" Youse guys need to read the NY Times more often - I'm kinda amazed this story hasn't been posted already. Especially the bit about stabbing the Talib in the eye with his combat knife! -
title: Army turn tables in Taliban ambush

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: Potius Pilate might well have written the same kind of report about nailing the 'King of the Jews' and his henchmen in another 'rebellious' part of the world on another Good Friday a while back. Ahh, Popsig - Don't you think it's dangerous that our men actually have arms? (I know, I know, the Second Amendment is at fault here) These Taliban guys are merely reformers, and were brutally shot down while on their way to blow up some school. A clear infringement on their right to do urban renewal. I hear you man! You know it's absolutely against my political agenda for the US to invade ANY country, no matter how despical they behave. Before 9/11 the Taliban pushed me to the limit on this - But, despite your claims, they did in fact kill a lot of my neighbors - And it's not part of my political agenda to avoid the ancient right of self defense. While I often agree with strictly tactical arguements about the use of air power - This little story I found heart warming - So sorry... Dave

content: http://www.military.com/news/article/April-2009/platoon...ml?col=1186032310810 Apparently those 'Taliban', or their cousins, did have a second thought. Ergo another 'Star Spangled War Story'. And don't this sound like the Pilate? "The company's relations with local villagers are cordial, but ultimately unhelpful, undermined by deception. After the platoon ambushed the Taliban patrol, for instance, elders arrived at the outpost to say the Americans had shot up a search party of local men who were looking for a lost girl. The company commander, Capt. James C. Howell, told the elders it was one of the most ridiculous lies he had ever heard." The Prince of Peace? Ridiculous! He's a rebel, he claimed to be 'King of the Jews". I come from Rome to bring peace and I have no doubts. I even have some etchings of the corpse for proof. Pax out, Pontius. This message has been edited. Last edited by: popsiq, Tue 21 April 2009 07:39 AM

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: http://www.military.com/news/article/April-2009/platoon...ml?col=1186032310810 Apparently those 'Taliban', or their cousins, did have a second thought. Ergo another 'Star Spangled War Story'. And don't this sound like the Pilate? "The company's relations with local villagers are cordial, but ultimately unhelpful, undermined by deception. After the platoon ambushed the Taliban patrol, for instance, elders arrived at the outpost to say the Americans had shot up a search party of local men who were looking for a lost girl. The company commander, Capt. James C. Howell, told the elders it was one of the most ridiculous lies he had ever heard." The Prince of Peace? Ridiculous! He's a rebel, he claimed to be 'King of the Jews". I come from Rome to bring peace and I have no doubts. Pax out, Pontius. The Times has been doing a series of stories on the war. They actually have some damn good reporters working in the field instead of a hotel in Kabul. Yesterday they ran a story about a patrol that didn't work out as well. And they ran stories about the locals, and how SOME of them suport the Taliban. You know Pops, it was one of the most rediculous lies to be told... You see, you're operating in the same kind of environment as so many of the posters you redicule operate. It's ALL one giant conspiracy. In your case, it's all a right wing conspiracy, in theirs, everything is a left wing conpiracys. And it sort of mimics those religious people who think that every falling leaf is a manifestation of the Lord - So in this case, these details were scripted in Washington - Part of the Big Plot... And every now and then there IS a little story that backs you up. While on the opposite side of the ideological fence, someone is going to quote that second story from yesterdays Times as PROOF that the liberal media never says anything good... Sure sign of End Times... Dave

Ergo another 'Star Spangled War Story'. And don't this sound like the Pilate? "The company's relations with local villagers are cordial, but ultimately unhelpful, undermined by deception. After the platoon ambushed the Taliban patrol, for instance, elders arrived at the outpost to say the Americans had shot up a search party of local men who were looking for a lost girl. The company commander, Capt. James C. Howell, told the elders it was one of the most ridiculous lies he had ever heard." The Prince of Peace? Ridiculous! He's a rebel, he claimed to be 'King of the Jews". I come from Rome to bring peace and I have no doubts. Pax out, Pontius. The Times has been doing a series of stories on the war. They actually have some damn good reporters working in the field instead of a hotel in Kabul. Yesterday they ran a story about a patrol that didn't work out as well. And they ran stories about the locals, and how SOME of them suport the Taliban. You know Pops, it was one of the most rediculous lies to be told... You see, you're operating in the same kind of environment as so many of the posters you redicule operate. It's ALL one giant conspiracy. In your case, it's all a right wing conspiracy, in theirs, everything is a left wing conpiracys. And it sort of mimics those religious people who think that every falling leaf is a manifestation of the Lord - So in this case, these details were scripted in Washington - Part of the Big Plot... And every now and then there IS a little story that backs you up. While on the opposite side of the ideological fence, someone is going to quote that second story from yesterdays Times as PROOF that the liberal media never says anything good... Sure sign of End Times... Dave The Times has done a number of stories on the eastern outposts going back three or four years. One was even turned into a TV documentary (Front line on PBS?) I don't see any conspiracy Grachus. What I do see is a bunch of keen young soldiers plonked down in the middle of somebody elses's foreign (in every sense of the word) backyard and focussed on bending the inhabitants to their will, by friendship if possible, by force if necessary. All the while having little knowledge of their environment beyond what their interpreters tell them, what they 'learned' in training and distrusting anybody who isn't wearing camo and kevlar. Add to that the ability to rain incredible destruction at whim on 'disaffected loggers taking the Taliban buck'. I wish there was a story that 'backed you up' Dave. That would be the one about victory and it being 'over'.

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: http://www.military.com/news/article/April-2009/platoon...ml?col=1186032310810 Apparently those 'Taliban', or their cousins, did have a second thought. Ergo another 'Star Spangled War Story'. And don't this sound like the Pilate? "The company's relations with local villagers are cordial, but ultimately unhelpful, undermined by deception. After the platoon ambushed the Taliban patrol, for instance, elders arrived at the outpost to say the Americans had shot up a search party of local men who were looking for a lost girl. The company commander, Capt. James C. Howell, told the elders it was one of the most ridiculous lies he had ever heard." The Prince of Peace? Ridiculous! He's a rebel, he claimed to be 'King of the Jews". I come from Rome to bring peace and I have no doubts. Pax out, Pontius. The Times has been doing a series of stories on the war. They actually have some damn good reporters working in the field instead of a hotel in Kabul. Yesterday they ran a story about a patrol that didn't work out as well. And they ran stories about the locals, and how SOME of them suport the Taliban. You know Pops, it was one of the most rediculous lies to be told... You see, you're operating in the same kind of environment as so many of the posters you redicule operate. It's ALL one giant conspiracy. In your case, it's all a right wing conspiracy, in theirs, everything is a left wing conpiracys. And it sort of mimics those religious people who think that every falling leaf is a manifestation of the Lord - So in this case, these details were scripted in Washington - Part of the Big Plot... And every now and then there IS a little story that backs you up. While on the opposite side of the ideological fence, someone is going to quote that second story from yesterdays Times as PROOF that the liberal media never says anything good... Sure sign of End Times... Dave The Times has done a number of stories on the eastern outposts going back three or four years. One was even turned into a TV documentary (Front line on PBS?) I don't see any conspiracy Grachus. What I do see is a bunch of keen young soldiers plonked down in the middle of somebody elses's foreign (in every sense of the word) backyard and focussed on bending the inhabitants to their will, by friendship if possible, by force if necessary. All the while having little knowledge of their environment beyond what their interpreters tell them, what they 'learned' in training and distrusting anybody who isn't wearing camo and kevlar. Add to that the ability to rain incredible destruction at whim on 'disaffected loggers taking the Taliban buck'. I wish there was a story that 'backed you up' Dave. That would be the one about victory and it being 'over'. As I've posted a number of times, I believe this war could have been won a long time ago, if we hadn't picked the worst elements in Afghanistan to run the country. But that was a political error, not an error by the military. The environment that we are fighting in, is a direct result of this political error. The military "errors" are simply a reflection of the fact that for almost four years we had only a tiny on the ground presence there, and the promised economic aid was all diverted to the endless swamp of Iraq. Very bad to make promises you don't intend to keep. Very bad to create the "appearance" of being foreign occupiers. Well, we shall see. The adults have taken over, and I continue to support our rightful act of self defense. In the meantime, I'm not going to shed any tears for the deaths of these fanatics. And THIS particular piece of "evidence" that we actually killed "innocents," simply calls into question all those other countless claims that all we do is kill innocents. Dave
